thread.title: Murray Eases His Way To Victory In Shanghai
thread.title_full: Murray Eases His Way To Victory In Shanghai

title: Murray Eases His Way To Victory In Shanghai
text:
Murray Eases His Way To Victory In Shanghai 11:27, UK, Wednesday 14 October 2015 Share by email Andy Murray has breezed into the third round of the Shanghai Rolex Masters with a straightforward 6-2 6-4 win over American Steve Johnson. 
Murray, who was playing his first match since helping Great Britain qualify for the Davis Cup last month, dropped his opening service game against world ranked No 47 Johnson. 
But the sluggish start was only a minor blip on an overall excellent performance by the British No 1. 
He immediately got the break-back in the first set and followed that up by winning four games on the bounce, eventually taking the first set against serve 6-2 in 34 minutes. 
Johnson was able to keep up with Murray in the second, with the set going on serve until 5-4. Once more Murray broke Johnson at the crucial time, taking the match in 1 hour and 16 minutes. 
After the match Murray told Sky Sports: "I thought I played well. I struck the ball very clean off both sides, returned well and the serve was good. 
"I got a lot of free points on the first serve and I was hitting my spots there when it landed. 
"I could have made things a bit easier in the second set, but I played well, I moved well, it was a good start for me." 
Murray will play John Isner in the next round. 
The big-serving American beat David Goffin in straight sets in Wednesday's second, but the American has a poor record against Murray having lost all four of their previous encounters. Promoted Stories
